channel.title: CVE Feed for Ping Identity -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Ping Identity -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-40722|2024-08-03T12:21:46.770Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20adapter%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: A misconfiguration of RSA padding implemented in the PingID Adapter for PingFederate to support Offline MFA with PingID mobile authenticators is vulnerable to pre-computed dictionary attacks, leading to a bypass of offline MFA.

item.title: CVE-2022-40724|2024-08-03T12:21:46.720Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: The PingFederate Local Identity Profiles '/pf/idprofile.ping' endpoint is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) through crafted GET requests.

item.title: CVE-2022-40725|2024-08-03T12:21:46.675Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20desktop%20for%20windows
item.description: PingID Desktop prior to the latest released version 1.7.4 contains a vulnerability that can be exploited to bypass the maximum PIN attempts permitted before the time-based lockout is activated.

item.title: CVE-2022-23719|2024-08-03T03:51:46.025Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20windows%20login
item.description: PingID Windows Login prior to 2.8 does not authenticate communication with a local Java service used to capture security key requests. An attacker with the ability to execute code on the target machine maybe able to exploit and spoof the local Java service using multiple attack vectors. A successful attack can lead to code executed as SYSTEM by the PingID Windows Login application, or even a denial of service for offline security key authentication.

item.title: CVE-2022-40723|2024-08-03T12:21:46.787Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20radius%20pcv
item.description: The PingID RADIUS PCV adapter for PingFederate, which supports RADIUS authentication with PingID MFA, is vulnerable to MFA bypass under certain configurations.

item.title: CVE-2022-23726|2024-08-03T03:51:45.964Z -- ping%20identity -- pingcentral
item.description: PingCentral versions prior to listed versions expose Spring Boot actuator endpoints that with administrative authentication return large amounts of sensitive environmental and application information.

item.title: CVE-2022-23720|2024-08-03T03:51:45.962Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20windows%20login
item.description: PingID Windows Login prior to 2.8 does not alert or halt operation if it has been provisioned with the full permissions PingID properties file. An IT administrator could mistakenly deploy administrator privileged PingID API credentials, such as those typically used by PingFederate, into PingID Windows Login user endpoints. Using sensitive full permissions properties file outside of a privileged trust boundary leads to an increased risk of exposure or discovery, and an attacker could leverage these credentials to perform administrative actions against PingID APIs or endpoints.

item.title: CVE-2022-23722|2024-08-03T03:51:46.174Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: When a password reset mechanism is configured to use the Authentication API with an Authentication Policy, email One-Time Password, PingID or SMS authentication, an existing user can reset another existing user’s password.

item.title: CVE-2022-23718|2024-08-03T03:51:46.036Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20windows%20login
item.description: PingID Windows Login prior to 2.8 uses known vulnerable components that can lead to remote code execution. An attacker capable of achieving a sophisticated man-in-the-middle position, or to compromise Ping Identity web servers, could deliver malicious code that would be executed as SYSTEM by the PingID Windows Login application.

item.title: CVE-2022-23723|2024-08-03T03:51:45.964Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate%20pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit
item.description: An MFA bypass vulnerability exists in the PingFederate PingOne MFA Integration Kit when adapter HTML templates are used as part of an authentication flow.

item.title: CVE-2022-23724|2024-08-03T03:51:46.013Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20integration%20for%20windows%20login
item.description: Use of static encryption key material allows forging an authentication token to other users within a tenant organization. MFA may be bypassed by redirecting an authentication flow to a target user. To exploit the vulnerability, must have compromised user credentials.

item.title: CVE-2022-23725|2024-08-03T03:51:46.172Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20windows%20login
item.description: PingID Windows Login prior to 2.8 does not properly set permissions on the Windows Registry entries used to store sensitive API keys under some circumstances.

item.title: CVE-2022-23721|2024-08-03T03:51:45.944Z -- ping%20identity -- unspecified
item.description: PingID integration for Windows login prior to 2.9 does not handle duplicate usernames, which can lead to a username collision when two people with the same username are provisioned onto the same machine at different times.

item.title: CVE-2022-23717|2024-08-03T03:51:45.972Z -- ping%20identity -- pingid%20windows%20login
item.description: PingID Windows Login prior to 2.8 is vulnerable to a denial of service condition on local machines when combined with using offline security keys as part of authentication.

item.title: CVE-2023-40545|2024-08-02T18:38:50.649Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: Authentication bypass when an OAuth2 Client is using client_secret_jwt as its authentication method on affected 11.3 versions via specially crafted requests.

item.title: CVE-2023-40148|2024-08-02T18:24:55.608Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: Server-side request forgery (SSRF) in PingFederate allows unauthenticated http requests to attack network resources and consume server-side resources via forged HTTP POST requests.

item.title: CVE-2023-40356|2024-08-02T18:31:53.903Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability related to the Prompt Users to Set Up MFA configuration. Under certain conditions, this configuration could allow for a new MFA device to be paired with a target user account without requiring second-factor authentication from the target’s existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to register their own MFA device with a target user’s account if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first factor credential.

item.title: CVE-2023-40702|2024-08-02T18:38:51.083Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability where the skipMFA action can be configured such that user authentication does not require the second factor authentication from the user's existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to authenticate as a target user if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first-factor credentials.

item.title: CVE-2024-23316|2024-08-01T22:59:32.210Z -- ping%20identity -- pingaccess
item.description: HTTP request desynchronization in Ping Identity PingAccess, all versions prior to 8.0.1 affected allows an attacker to send specially crafted http header requests to create a request smuggling condition for proxied requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-21832|2024-08-01T22:27:36.324Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: A potential JSON injection attack vector exists in PingFederate REST API data stores using the POST method and a JSON request body.

item.title: CVE-2024-22377|2024-08-01T22:43:34.512Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: The deploy directory in PingFederate runtime nodes is reachable to unauthorized users.

item.title: CVE-2024-22477|2024-08-01T22:51:09.905Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: A cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin console OIDC Policy Management Editor. The impact is contained to admin console users only.

item.title: CVE-2024-22377|2024-07-23T16:13:24.203Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: The deploy directory in PingFederate runtime nodes is reachable to unauthorized users.

item.title: CVE-2024-21832|2024-07-10T14:03:06.101Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: A potential JSON injection attack vector exists in PingFederate REST API data stores using the POST method and a JSON request body.

item.title: CVE-2023-40356|2024-07-09T16:01:04.622Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability related to the Prompt Users to Set Up MFA configuration. Under certain conditions, this configuration could allow for a new MFA device to be paired with a target user account without requiring second-factor authentication from the target’s existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to register their own MFA device with a target user’s account if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first factor credential.

item.title: CVE-2023-40148|2024-04-10T00:03:31.966Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: Server-side request forgery (SSRF) in PingFederate allows unauthenticated http requests to attack network resources and consume server-side resources via forged HTTP POST requests.

item.title: CVE-2023-40545|2024-02-06T17:28:00.505Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: Authentication bypass when an OAuth2 Client is using client_secret_jwt as its authentication method on affected 11.3 versions via specially crafted requests.

item.title: CVE-2024-23316|2024-06-05T18:41:55.387Z -- ping%20identity -- pingaccess
item.description: HTTP request desynchronization in Ping Identity PingAccess, all versions prior to 8.0.1 affected allows an attacker to send specially crafted http header requests to create a request smuggling condition for proxied requests.

item.title: CVE-2023-40702|2024-07-09T15:38:47.415Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability where the skipMFA action can be configured such that user authentication does not require the second factor authentication from the user's existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to authenticate as a target user if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first-factor credentials.

item.title: CVE-2023-40356|2024-07-09T15:38:56.245Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability related to the Prompt Users to Set Up MFA configuration. Under certain conditions, this configuration could allow for a new MFA device to be paired with a target user account without requiring second-factor authentication from the target’s existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to register their own MFA device with a target user’s account if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first factor credential.

item.title: CVE-2024-22477|2024-07-10T13:30:14.614Z -- ping%20identity -- pingfederate
item.description: A cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin console OIDC Policy Management Editor. The impact is contained to admin console users only.

item.title: CVE-2023-40702|2024-07-12T20:21:31.325Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability where the skipMFA action can be configured such that user authentication does not require the second factor authentication from the user's existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to authenticate as a target user if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first-factor credentials.

item.title: CVE-2024-23600|2024-08-01T16:55:22.291Z -- ping%20identity -- openidm
item.description: Improper Input Validation of query search results for private field data in PingIDM OPENIDM (Query Filter module) allows for a potentially efficient brute forcing approach leading to information disclosure.
